result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela Marie Skorczewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angela Marie Skorczewski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Angela Marie Skorczewski was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant may petition Court in writing, after one year, for expunction of record, contingent upon successful completion of probation and no convictions of any new offenses.
Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation terminated on 8-22-17; unpaid supervision fees of $140
filed by defendant/counsel
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

Cases called: 16CM80, 16TR696 & 16TR694, 16CT276, Defendant Angela Marie Skorczewski in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived in 16CT276. Rights/elements. Defendant plead no contest to count 1 in each case. Court found defendant guilty. Cts. 3&4 in 16CM80 dismissed and filed in new case. In 16CT276, count 1, OWI, 5 days jail commencing tonight at 7 p.m.  $1,379 fine,  60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. $65 blood draw fee, 12 month revocation, 12 month IID.   Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Submit DNA sample. PAC read in and dismissed. Court granted 1 day jail credit. All traffic citations dismissed.  In 16CM80, count 1, possess THC, 1 year probation, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. $443 costs. Defendant may petition Court in writing, after one year, for expunction of record, contingent upon successful completion of probation and no convictions of any new offenses. Ct. 2 dismissed. No jail credit.
Cases called: 16CM80, 16TR696 & 16TR694, Defendant Angela Marie Skorczewski in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case to be recalled later.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant, Angela Marie Skorczewski, appeared with Attorney Tristan Eagon. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1,000 recog. bond set with Maintain absolute sobriety.
